intro: Lasianthus laxinervis, commonly known as the slender-veined lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including parts of India, Sri Lanka, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in spikes, often displaying vibrant colors such as pink or purple. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
